author: Jen Shieff
title: TV series review: The Regime includes moments of unexpected ghastliness - NZ Herald
text:
The Regime (M). Six-episode miniseries on Sky’s Soho; streaming on Neon.
Directed by Jessica Hobbs and Stephen Frears.
If you enjoyed the moments of unexpected ghastliness in The Menu or The White Lotus , then The Regime is definitely for you.
Others with an appreciation of satirical attacks on the privileged will enjoy it too.
Advertisement Advertise with NZME. Kate Winslet , dazzling in her role, stars as Elena Vernham, a mostly benevolent despotic ruler of a fictitious central European country, the primary resource of which is cobalt.
The Chancellor, as Elena likes to be known, has thinly disguised tyrannical tendencies and a father, the previous despot, who she keeps in a Lenin-like glass coffin, visiting him to gain reassurance or approval of her leadership, both of which are denied - unsurprising, given he’s a decaying corpse.
Carrying on regardless, she seeks any opportunity to address her people in an Absolutely Fabulous accent, calling them “my loves”.
Each episode opens with a plunge, most dramatically the plunge into the desolate landscape that opens episode six, with the Chancellor and her lover emerging from a camouflaged trapdoor in the vastness, hilariously over-the-top scared, on the run from the risen rabble.
Advertisement Advertise with NZME. The only character who seems to be not disturbed in some way is Agnes (Andrea Riseborough), the earnest palace housekeeper and mother of a boy with epilepsy, a boy claimed by the Chancellor as her own, although her version of co-parenting is weird, to say the least.
Agnes can’t do a thing about it, too loyal and trusting to object.
Food, mould, phobia and natural remedies are given almost equal significance to the references to the interests of America and China in the country’s cobalt, but all that is the tinsel over the gift the series brings us.
It’s a wicked commentary on the fickleness of love and what a leader can expect to happen to them if they believe in themselves blindly.
There’s a suggestion of democracy in the Chancellor’s ineffectual cabinet, with key members being played by Henry Goodman and David Bamber, but they seem to exist merely to plot against her despite knowing the Chancellor’s castle’s dungeons are beneath them, one containing a dissenting liberal played whimsically by Hugh Grant.
Unstable corporal Herbert Zubak (a superb Matthias Schoenaerts), a noble savage, comes to be regarded by the Chancellor as her oracle.
The passionate relationship that evolves between them - after the Chancellor has him tortured and seems happy to leave him for dead - makes a bizarre kind of sense, as does the Chancellor’s rejection of her limp husband Nicholas (Guillaume Gallienne).
Written by Succession’s Will Tracy, with Jessica Hobbs and Stephen Frears each directing three of the six episodes, it’s executive-produced by Succession and Veep ’s Frank Rich.
The Chancellor has more than a few of Logan Roy’s genes.
Things fall apart for the Chancellor over her efforts to reunify her country with an ex-territory, the Faban Corridor, a sort of “Putin versus Ukraine” reference, and her assumption her people can’t think for themselves.
Advertisement Advertise with NZME. She’s Trumpian, Thatcher-esque, Orwellian, riding roughshod over the concept that democracy is better than totalitarianism, unintentionally reminding us to be really careful when we vote.

author: Poder360 ·
title: Sudeste tem alerta de temporais e deslizamentos até domingo
text:
Sudeste tem alerta de temporais e deslizamentos até domingo
Chuva, que pode atingir até 100 milímetros em 24 horas, é consequência de frente fria que se aproxima da região Sul
A frente fria que chega ao Sudeste na 6ª feira (22.mar.2024) deverá provocar chuvas de até 100 mm (milímetros) em 24 horas, alagamentos e deslizamentos de terra na região. Em alguns pontos, como no Rio de Janeiro, o volume de chuva poderá somar 200 milímetros até domingo (24.mar).
A chuva é consequência da aproximação de uma frente fria que avançou pela região Sul do país nesta 5ª feira (21.mar). O Cemaden (Centro Nacional de Monitoramento e Alertas de Desastres Naturais) informou nesta 5ª feira (21.mar) que os maiores volumes de chuvas devem ser registrados entre a noite de 6ª feira e a madrugada de sábado.
“Isso já é um problema, porque provavelmente vamos acumular volumes importantes de chuva durante a madrugada de sábado, e sabemos que a logística se torna mais difícil”, disse o diretor de Operações do Cemaden, Marcelo Seluchi.
Segundo o Inmet (Instituto Nacional de Meteorologia), na noite desta noite, já podem ser registradas algumas áreas com chuva forte, descargas elétricas, granizo e rajadas de vento em São Paulo e no Paraná. A partir de amanhã, há previsão de acumulado muito alto de chuvas que pegam desde o litoral norte de São Paulo, todo o Estado do Rio de Janeiro, a Zona da Mata de Minas Gerais e o sul do Espírito Santo.
“Se a gente pegar os acumulados de chuva de hoje até domingo, podemos ter até mais de 200 mm nessas áreas”, disse a coordenadora do Inmet, Márcia Seabra. Segundo ela, também há previsão de ressacas em algumas áreas e ondas de até 2,5 metros no litoral do Rio de Janeiro.
No Rio de Janeiro, as regiões mais atingidas serão a Costa Verde, a região metropolitana e, especialmente, a região serrana, onde poderá haver deslizamentos de terras mais generalizados.
“Levando em conta o volume previsto, não podemos descartar episódios mais graves como corrida de massa ou corrida de detritos”, disse Seluchi. Essa situação pode abranger também a parte sul de Minas Gerais, que faz divisa com o Estado do Rio.
Em São Paulo, há possibilidade de inundações mais rápidas, com alagamentos urbanos ou transbordamento de córregos. Os deslizamentos de terra em São Paulo também serão mais pontuais e esparsos, mas pode haver interrupção de algumas estradas, como a rodovia dos Tamoios, que tem um protocolo de fechamento quando a chuva ultrapassa 100 mm.
A orientação para a população das áreas atingidas é observar as recomendações dos serviços de Defesa Civil municipais, estaduais e nacionais, por meio das redes sociais e canais oficiais.
“Em locais onde há sirenes, a população deve seguir as orientações, deixando suas casas no momento em que o alerta é emitido”, diz o diretor do Cenad (Centro Nacional de Gerenciamento de Riscos e Desastres), Armin Braun.
Para receber alertas da Defesa Civil por SMS, basta enviar uma mensagem para o número 40199 com o CEP de sua região. O contato também pode ser feito pelo telefone 199, o WhatsApp (61) 2034-4611 ou Telegram @defesacivilbrbot.
Com informações da
Agência Brasil.

author: Анастасия Бочевская
title: Почему в Мексике туристов тихо ненавидят: к такому россияне точно не привыкли
text:
Мурманская область
ВЫБЕРИТЕ ГОРОД

Версия для печати
Почему в Мексике туристов тихо ненавидят: к такому россияне точно не привыкли
Сегодня, 01 мая в 04:02, Россия/мир
Что в туристах дико бесит мексиканцев
Фото: kuoni.co.uk
Мексиканские курорты — это экзотично, колоритно и увлекательно. Однако это государство в Северной Америке демонстрирует не только ухоженные пляжи и достопримечательности. Многое значит и отношение местных к туристам.
О необычном нюансе в поведении мексиканцев рассказала
путешественница Марина Ершова.
По ее словам, на отдыхе, особенно если ездить по Мексике «своим ходом», многое портит экономность граждан.
Особенно это касается водоснабжения. Отключение воды в населенных пунктах — обычное дело. Причина тому — износ систем водоснабжения: дырявые трубы и утечки, «профилактики».
Доходит до того, что мексиканцы сидят без воды не часами и днями, а неделями,
уточнила
Ершова. Поэтому с детства местных «дрессируют», приучая обходиться своими силами и жестко экономя.
Соответственно, в Мексике не всегда удастся искупаться, включать кран без особой необходимости нельзя, мыть фрукты и овощи — строго дозированно. Поэтому несведущие туристы, моющие руки вдоволь, вызывают у мексиканцев не оторопь, а праведный гнев, уточнила Марина.
Как отметила путешественница, местные сразу «точат зуб» на неэкономных приезжих, считая их расточителями. Поэтому, чтобы не гневить хозяев, приходится копить грязное белье и одежду и минимизировать гигиену.
Ранее мы
рассказывали
, чем может отпугнуть Египет.

author: SBT
title: Cavalo é agredido por carroceiro na zona oeste do Rio - SBT News
text: Cavalo é agredido por carroceiro na zona oeste do Rio Homem foi detido e deve responder por maus-tratos a animais, que pode ser punido com até cinco anos de prisão Um vídeo que circula nas redes sociais mostra o momento em que um cavalo é agredido a enxadadas por um carroceiro na manhã desta quinta-feira (13) em Sepetiba, na zona oeste do Rio de Janeiro. É possível ver que o animal se abaixa enquanto os golpes são desferidos pelo homem. O presidente da Comissão de Defesa dos Animais da Câmara do Rio, Luiz Ramos Filho, compartilhou o vídeo no Instagram e disse que acionaria a Delegacia de Proteção ao Meio Ambiente. Os agentes receberam a denúncia e chegaram ao local onde as agressões aconteceram nesta tarde. Se for indiciado por maus-tratos a animais, o agressor pode pegar até cinco anos de prisão. O caso é investigado pela Delegacia de Proteção ao Meio Ambiente (DPMA). Assim que tomou conhecimento do fato, uma equipe da unidade foi ao local para reunir provas e conseguiu identificar o autor. Ele foi detido na tarde desta quinta-feira e vai responder por maus-tratos a animais. O homem seria dono de dois equinos utilizados para carregar entulhos, prática proibida. Os animais foram levados para o Centro de Controle de Zoonoses por funcionários da prefeitura.

author: Dana Becker
title: Dreshaun Ross, one of top wrestling recruits in nation, set for debut for Fort Dodge
text:
Dreshaun Ross, one of top wrestling recruits in nation, set for debut for Fort Dodge
Dreshaun Ross, one of the top wrestling recruits in the nation who holds several Div. I offers, is expected to make his debut on the mats for Fort Dodge Senior High Thursday night.
Ross, who underwent shoulder surgery in the offseason, is a junior who has won two state wrestling championships.
According to a report in the Fort Dodge Messenger, Ross has “gotten back into his pre-meet preparation mode, and you’ve seen him turn the corner both physically and mentally recently,” Fort Dodge head coach Bobby Thompson said.
Along with having multiple wrestling offers to Power 5 programs, Ross is a football recruit whol holds numerous offers on the gridiron. He will compete at 215 pounds against Ames in a dual for his first action of the season.
This past October, Ross was named the Iowa/USA Boys Junior Wrestler of the Year.

author: archyde
title: Pope Francis leads the Pentecost mass on the Vatican - Archyde
text:
VATICAN CITY.- This Sunday, the Pope Francisco inspired the Church and its trustworthy to proceed “talking of peace to those that need warfare” or “of welcome and solidarity to those that shut the doorways” of society, throughout the Pentecost mass .
“We’re invited to announce the Gospel to everybody, all the time going past not solely in a geographical sense but additionally ethnic and spiritual obstacles for a very common mission,” he invited, quoting the encyclical. “Mission of the Redeemer” (1990) John Paul II .
The holy father in his homily spoke of the motion of the Holy Spirit whose revelation is widely known on Pentecost, on the fiftieth day after Easter, and identified that because of that energy, evangelization “can and ought to be executed with the identical energy and the identical gentleness.”
“Not with vanity or impositions. The Christian isn’t smug however his energy is completely different, it’s that of the spirit. And never with calculations, crafty, however with the power that comes from constancy to the reality,” the pontiff said.
Thus, he known as to “not hand over,” “to proceed talking of peace to those that need warfare, of forgiveness to those that sow revenge, of welcome and solidarity to those that shut the doorways and erect obstacles, of life to those that select demise, of respect “who likes to humiliate, insult and discard.”
But in addition talking of “constancy to those that reject all ties, complicated freedom with a superficial, opaque and empty individualism.”
Pope Francis led the Pentecost mass, this Sunday, Might 19, in St. Peter’s Basilica, within the Vatican Credit score: EFE/EPA/CLAUDIO PERI
To this finish, the bishop of Rome inspired the trustworthy “to not be intimidated by the difficulties, humiliations and resistances that, each at the moment and yesterday, – he mentioned – should not missing in apostolic life.”
The Supreme Pontiff of the Catholic Church, earlier than the trustworthy who attended the basilica of Saint Peter and a few 250 members of the Curia, reiterated one of many key concepts of his ministry, that of not excluding or rejecting anybody due to their decisions or methods of life.
“Our announcement have to be mild to welcome everybody. Let’s not neglect this, everybody, everybody, everybody. Allow us to not neglect that parable of the company who didn’t need to go to the occasion. Go to the streets and convey everybody, good and unhealthy,” she completed.

author: Tony Kukulich tkukulich@postandcourier.com
title: Mercury will plunge as cold fronts move into the Lowcountry. How low will the temps go?
text:
By Tony Kukulich tkukulich@postandcourier.com Tony Kukulich
Tony Kukulich is an editor/reporter working in the Beaufort County bureau. Turning to journalism as a second career, he started as a photojournalist in the San Francisco Bay Area in 2015. After moving to Bluffton in 2021, he wrote for several area publications before starting with The Post and Courier the following year. His work has been recognized by the National Newspaper Association, the California Newspaper Publishers Association and the South Carolina Press Association. Tony covers local government, environmental issues and development in addition to authoring the Hurricane Wire newsletter.
Author email Jan 3, 2025 15 mins ago Facebook Twitter WhatsApp SMS Email Buy Now A pair of cold fronts are expected to move through the Lowcountry over the next week, dropping overnight temperatures into the 20s inland and 30s closer to the coast.
File/Staff Facebook Twitter WhatsApp SMS Email Print Copy article link Save Temperatures across the Lowcountry are set to bounce as a pair of cold fronts separated by a few days of warming are headed into the region.
The first front is expected to move in Jan. 3 and remain in place for most of the weekend. Winds will pick up as the systems approach, and small craft advisories could be issued for local waters.
Lows in the upper 20s — or lower 30s closer to the coast — are expected the night of Jan. 3, and temperatures are forecast to drop a few more degrees the following night. The daytime highs will follow a similar pattern, with Jan. 3 highs just below 60 and high temperatures Jan. 4 about 10 degrees cooler.
The first cold snap will be fairly short lived, and temperatures will moderate a bit Jan. 5.
"The swings with the temperatures are pretty normal for this time of year," said Anna Dennis, a Charleston-based National Weather Service meteorologist.
Beaufort County News Beaufort County passes on Passiment as chair amid 'secret meeting' concerns By Jessica Wade jwade@postandcourier.com Rain will follow Jan. 6, with only modest accumulations of up to a quarter inch expected. The rain will help offset the dry conditions that exist in portions of the Lowcountry. Latest data from the U.S. Drought Monitor shows that Berkeley, Charleston and Dorchester counties are experiencing either abnormally dry or moderate drought conditions. Portions of Beaufort and Colleton counties also are abnormally dry.
Anyone hoping that the combination of chilly temperatures and precipitation will mean a coating of snow likely will be disappointed. Temperatures are expected to remain above freezing while the rain moves through. The current National Weather Service forecast does not call for any frozen precipitation in the region.
The process begins to repeat itself on Jan. 6 as another front moves in. There will be one difference, however.
"We'll see considerably colder weather behind this second front," said NWS meteorologist Douglas Berry.
Military Digest North and South clashed 160 years ago. Now cadaver dogs are sniffing out clues on a SC battlefield. By Tony Kukulich tkukulich@postandcourier.com By the night of Jan. 6, temperatures will be in the mid-20s. The following two nights are expected to be even colder. Cold weather advisories are issued when temperatures drop to 20 degrees or lower.
"Wednesday night looks to be the coldest of the week," Berry said.
Cold temperatures could be problematic for gardens and outdoor plants, particularly those that can't be brought indoors.
"If you know that you're going to have a frost, you're going to want to cover your plants up," said Glen Payne, an urban horticulture agent with Clemson University's Beaufort County Extension Office.

author: m.b.
title: Video | Vendedora de 'melones' causa polémica en redes sociales por sus atributos físicos | Vanguardia.com
text: Cinthya, una joven emprendedora que se dedica a la venta de frutas frescas en su puesto callejero, ha alcanzado la fama en la reconocida plataforma de videos cortos con una grabación sumamente divertida. En este video de apenas 15 segundos, se muestra a Cinthya ofreciendo melones a un conductor que pasa por el lugar. Sin embargo, lo que hace que el video sea tan entretenido es el comentario que hace Cinthya después de que el conductor elige sus melones y paga por ellos. La respuesta del público ha sido inmediata, con más de un millón de reproducciones en TikTok en tan solo unas pocas horas. Lo que añade aún más intriga a esta historia es que detrás de esta ingeniosa broma está una sorprendente revelación: Cinthya también es modelo de OnlyFans. Con un toque de humor y creatividad, esta emprendedora ha encontrado una manera única no solo de promocionar su puesto de frutas, sino también de aumentar su visibilidad en otras plataformas en línea. Los comentarios en el video no se han hecho esperar, con usuarios expresando desde asombro hasta hilaridad ante la ocurrencia de Cinthya. Algunos han comparado su estilo con el de otras personalidades conocidas en las redes sociales, mientras que otros simplemente han elogiado su ingenio y sentido del humor. @cinthyach00oficial vendiendo melones ♬ sonido original - Cinthya CH vendiendo melones Esta historia demuestra cómo la creatividad y el ingenio pueden convertirse en poderosas herramientas de marketing en el mundo digital de hoy. Desde vender frutas en la calle hasta conquistar las redes sociales, Cinthya ha demostrado que el humor puede ser un aliado invaluable en el mundo del comercio electrónico. Sin duda, esta vendedora de frutas ha logrado dejar una impresión duradera en el mundo digital, recordándonos que a veces, todo lo que se necesita es una buena dosis de creatividad para destacar en un mercado saturado de contenido.
